I just followed the Wiki installation instruction and afterwards I was
havi=
ng problems running both the Python and MATLAB demos.  The error
was in set=
ting the environmental variable Path.  The demos would not
run when I added=
 "C:\Python25\Python.exe" to the path, but would/will
run when I added "C:\=
Python25" to the path.  

I'm not sure if this is because my processor is a=
n AMD Turion64x2, but
I highly doubt it.  I'm using Windows XP, Python25, n=
umarray-1.5.2,
and Cantera 1.7.1. 

Afterwards however, it took a lot longe=
r to run the Python demo,
'adiabatic', than it too to run the Matlab demo, =
'equil'.  This is my
first time using Python, let alone in conjunction with=
 Cantera, so I'm
not sure if this is normal.  I've only ever used SCT-Cante=
ra with
Matlab (for the past three years).

If this has occurred with other=
 people, I would suggest updating the
Wiki install page - it took me a coup=
le hours to figure out what was
going on.  
 

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.c=
om, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> To simplify installing Cantera,=
 I have created a page on the Cantera  
> wiki that contains links to curre=
nt versions of all installers (3)  
> needed to do a binary install of Cant=
era on a PC.  All you need to to  
> is select each link, run the installer=
, and do some minor  
> configuration (also described on this page).  Start=
ing from scratch,  
> it should be possible to install a working Cantera in=
stallation from  
> this page in just a few minutes.
> 
> http://www.canter=
a.org/wiki/index.php/Installers_for_Windows
> 
> The links on this page wil=
l be updated as versions change, so that it  
> will always download packag=
es compatible with the latest version of  
> Cantera.
> 
> Similar pages fo=
r Mac and linux are coming soon.

> Dave
